title: Bank Gothic Alternative
content:
Hi,

I need some ideas on typefaces similar to Bank Gothic.

I will be using it in a Logo Mark for a Bespoke Tailor as a secondary typeface.

Thanks
author: vonslam

comments.content:
Red Rooster's [Banque Gothique](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060629/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=banque) adds additional widths.  
Eric Olson's [Stratum](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060629/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=stratum%20ot) offers lowercase and two variations, #2 with flat terminals.  
 [Sackers Square Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060629/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/monotype/sackers_square_gothic_std_regular/) predates Bank Gothic for an older, more rigid, yet handmade look.

I'm not sure if this works for a tailor, but for something that looks more modern, [FF Oxide](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060629/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_oxide_ot/) seems to be drawn with Bank Gothic in mind.
Eurostile Extended is nice if your only other choice is Bank Gothic, but it could wind up making the product look Trekkie.
Good call, Christian. Added it to my [list](http://web.archive.org/web/20150215060629/http:/www.fontshop.com/fontcase/alternatives/bank_gothic/).
